alert.note: Alert for Evangeline; Lafayette; Northern Acadia; Southern Acadia; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 6:28AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LAFAYETTE...SOUTHEASTERN EVANGELINE...ACADIA...NORTHWESTERN ST. MARTIN AND ST. LANDRY PARISHES THROUGH 715 AM CST... At 628 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bayou Chicot to Egan. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Crowley, Eunice, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Ville Platte, Church Point, Mamou, Iota, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Mermentau, Palmetto, Bayou Current, and Morrow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 67 and 121. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Evangeline; Lafayette; Northern Acadia; Southern Acadia; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
